isis.stitle: International® T 444E Diesel Engine - Model Years Late 1997 to 2003 - Crankcase, Crankshaft, Connecting Rods, And Pistons - Crankshaft and Main Bearings - Check Crankshaft Journals for Out-of-Round and Taper

svcproc.title: Check Crankshaft Journals for Out-of-Round and Taper

step1.para: To check for an out-of-round condition, measure each end of each journal at two points, 90° apart from each other (4 measurements total).

note.para: When taking crankshaft measurements, it is important to keep the micrometer clear of the crankshaft fillet radius.

step2.para: Take the first two measurements taken in the same position (one measurement at each end of the journal) and record the average.
Again, take the second set of measurements taken in the other position (at 90° to the first set, one measurement at each end of the journal) and record the average.
Subtract the smaller averaged value from the larger averaged value. This will yield the amount of out-of-round.

step1.para: To determine journal taper, use the measurements taken in Step 1.

step2.para: Record the average of two measurements taken at one end of the journal.
Record the average of the other two measurements at the other side of the journal.
Subtract the smaller averaged value from the larger averaged value. This will yield the amount of taper from one end of the journal to the other.

caution.para: If any journals exceed either the maximum out-of-round or maximum taper specifications, the crankshaft must be replaced or reground and undersize bearings installed. Failure to do so may result in engine damage.
